content:
<ce:section-title>Preparation of compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>
</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">A mixture of K<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>P<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>W<ce:inf loc="post">18</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">62</ce:inf>·14H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), Cu(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.088<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), oxalic acid dihydrate (0.02<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), 4,4′-bipyridine (0.062<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.4<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in a mixture of ethanol (2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) and H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (8<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) was stirred for 30<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min (pH about 2.0). The mixture was then sealed in a 23<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL Teflon reactor and kept under autogenous pressure at 160<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C for 5 days, and then cooled to room temperature at a rate of 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>. Red crystals were obtained in 54% yield (based on W). Anal. Calcd (%) for C<ce:inf loc="post">84</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">89</ce:inf>Cu<ce:inf loc="post">7</ce:inf>K<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">131</ce:inf>P<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>W<ce:inf loc="post">36</ce:inf> (10683.78): C, 9.44; H, 0.84; Cu, 4.16; K, 0.73; N, 2.09; P, 1.15; W, 61.95. Found (%): C, 9.86; H, 0.83; Cu, 4.00; K, 0.68; N, 2.00; P, 1.06; W, 61.75.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Preparation of compound 1 

A mixture of K6P2W18O62⋅14H2O (0.5g, 0.1mmol), Cu(NO3)2⋅6H2O (0.088g, 0.3mmol), oxalic acid dihydrate (0.02g, 0.2mmol), 4,4'-bipyridine (0.062g, 0.4mmol) in a mixture of ethanol (2mL) and H2O (8mL) was stirred for 30min (pH about 2.0). The mixture was then sealed in a 23mL Teflon reactor and kept under autogenous pressure at 160°C for 5 days, and then cooled to room temperature at a rate of 10°Ch-1. Red crystals were obtained in 54% yield (based on W). Anal. Calcd (%) for C84H89Cu7K2N16O131P4W36 (10683.78): C, 9.44; H, 0.84; Cu, 4.16; K, 0.73; N, 2.09; P, 1.15; W, 61.95. Found (%): C, 9.86; H, 0.83; Cu, 4.00; K, 0.68; N, 2.00; P, 1.06; W, 61.75.
